text.section:
A system may not pledge all or any part of the revenues received from:
A State appropriation;
Contracts, grants, or gifts received or to be received by a system, other than contracts for tuition, student fees, activity fees, or auxiliary facilities fees; or
Any other source not expressly authorized by the General Assembly.

section.section:
Bonds outstanding do not include:
Bonds previously issued by a system or any predecessor that are to be refunded, but only:
Borrowings pursuant to § 12-105(c) of this article, except to the extent that such borrowings are subject to a financing agreement the term of which is for more than 5 years for the acquisition of the personal property.

A system may not issue bonds for the purpose of financing all or any part of the costs of any academic facility or facilities until the General Assembly has approved in an act the:
Project or projects for any academic facility or facilities; and
Maximum principal amount of bonds a system may issue in connection with such project or projects for any academic facility or facilities.

The General Assembly's approval shall expressly authorize the project or projects for any academic facility or facilities and the maximum principal amount of bonds a system may issue in connection with such project or projects for the academic facility or facilities.

Without the approval of the General Assembly, a system may issue bonds to refinance all or any part of the costs of any project for any academic facility or facilities for which a system previously issued bonds under the authority of this section.

Any bonds issued under the requirements of this subsection shall mature at such times not exceeding the useful life of the project for which the bonds are issued, but not later than 21 years after their respective dates of issue, as may be determined by a system.

Any bonds issued in accordance with paragraph (3) of this subsection shall mature at such times as may be determined by a system, but not later than 21 years after the date of issue of the bonds that were originally issued for the academic facility or facilities authorized under the requirements of this subsection.

A system shall maintain records identifying the sources and amounts of payments used to support:
The auxiliary facilities; and
The academic facilities authorized under the requirements of this subtitle.

A system shall report:
By September 1 to the Board of Public Works and, subject to § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, to the Department of Legislative Services, the information for the prior fiscal year required under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
By December 1, subject to § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, to the Department of Legislative Services, the anticipated sources and amounts of payments required for the next fiscal year for:
